dict

{'filters.rejects': [], 'sink.mode': True, 'filters.accepts': [], 'sink.diff': 'diff -u', 'sink.whitespace': True}

dict() -> new empty dictionary. dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs. dict(seq) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in seq: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

dict

{'': <class sink.tracking.Engine at 0x112a420>, 'link': <class sink.linking.Engine at 0x112acf0>, 'list': <class sink.tracking.Engine at 0x112a420>}

dict() -> new empty dictionary. dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs. dict(seq) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in seq: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

str

"Sink - v.0.9.8\n\n Sink is the swiss army-knife for many common development synchronisation\n needs.\n\n Usage: sink [OPERATION?] [ARGUMENTS]\n\n OPERATION the operation you want to use ('changes' by default, see below)\n ARGUMENTS the arguments to the operations (use --help to know more)\n\n Operations:\n\n changes (DEF) Lists the changes between two or more directories\n link Manage synchrnoisation links between files\n help Gives detailed help about a specific operation\n\n Type 'sink help changes' or 'sink changes --help' to get detailed information\n about the 'changes' operation.\n\n"

str(object) -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

Method __init__

__init__( self, state, location, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a new directory node.

Same operations as the file system node.

Method __repr__

__repr__( self )
Undocumented

Method _appendToWalkPath

_appendToWalkPath( self, walkPath )

Appends this node to the given walk path. This allows to iterate nodes using the given `walkPath', which is a list.

Directory node is appended first, then children are appended in alphabetical order.

Method _attributeInSignature

_attributeInSignature( self, attributeName )

Tells wether the given attribute name should be used in the computation of the signature.

Method _belongsToState

_belongsToState( self, state )

Sets the given state as this node state. This invalidates makes the node uncached.

Method _updateSignature

_updateSignature( self )

A directory signature is the signature of the string composed of the names of all of its elements.

Method appendChild

appendChild( self, child )

Appends a child node to this directory. The list of children is automatically maintained as sorted.

Method children

children( self )
Undocumented

Method getChildren

getChildren( self, types=None )

Returns the children of this directory. The optional `types' list enumerates the classes of the the returned children, acting as a type filter. By default, types are DirectoryNodeState and FileNodeState.

Method hasChildren

hasChildren( self )
Undocumented

Method isDirectory

isDirectory( self )

Returns True.

Method update

update( self, nodeSignatureFilter= at 0x112c070> )

Updates the given directory node signature and attributes-information. The directory node location MUST exist.

The nodeSignatureFilter allows to filter each node and decided wether its signature should be computed or not. By default, every node has its signature computed.

WARNING: Updating a directory nodes updates its children list according to the local file system, so new nodes are always created for new directories and files.

Method walkChildren

walkChildren( self, function, context=None )

Applies the given function to every child of this node.

Method _setParent

_setParent( self, nodeState )

Sets the parent NodeState for this node.

Method _updateAttributes

_updateAttributes( self )

Gathers the attributes related to this file system node.

Method doOnParents

doOnParents( self, function )

Apply this function on this node parent, on the parent parent… until the root node is reached.

Method exists

exists( self )

Returns true if the node exists on the local filesystem

Method getAbsoluteLocation

getAbsoluteLocation( self )

Returns the node location, which implies that the location has been assigned a state.

Method getAttribute

getAttribute( self, info )

Returns the attributes information with the given name

Method getAttributes

getAttributes( self )

Returns the attributes of this node.

Method getAttributesSignature

getAttributesSignature( self )

Returns the signature of the attributes. Attributes listed in ATTRIBUTESNOTIN_SIGNATURE are not taken into account in the computation of the node signature.

Method getContentSignature

getContentSignature( self )
Undocumented

Method getSignature

getSignature( self )

Returns the concatenation of the content signature and the attributes signature, separated by a dash.

Method isCached

isCached( self, value=None )

Tells wether the node is cached, or not.

Method location

location( self, location=None )

Sets the location that this node represents, relatively to the state root

Method name

name( self )

Returns the name of this node. This corresponds to the basename of this node location.

Method tag

tag( self, _name=None, **tags )

Tags the given node with the following list of tags (given as named arguments). If a single argument is given, then the value of the given tag is returned.

Method usesSignature

usesSignature( self )

Tells wether this node should copmute its SHA-1 signature when updated.

tuple

(<class sink.tracking.NodeState at 0x112a300>,)

Method _updateSignature

_updateSignature( self )

A file signature is the signature of its content.

Method getData

getData( self )

Returns the data contained in this file as a string.

Method isDirectory

isDirectory( self )

Returns False.

Method __init__

__init__( self, state, location, usesSignature=True, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a file system node with the given location. The location is relative to the state root. The usesSignature parameter allows to specify wether the node should use a signature or not. Large file nodes may take too long to compute their signature, in which case this attributes comes in handy.

The update' method should be called to initilize the signature and attributes attributes from the local filesystem, but this implies that the nodes exists on the file system. Otherwise the attributes' and `contentSignature' attributes can be set by hand.

Method __repr__

__repr__( self )

Class FileNodeState

A node representing a file on the filesystem.

Method __init__

__init__( self, state, location, usesSignature=True, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a file system node with the given location. The location is relative to the state root. The usesSignature parameter allows to specify wether the node should use a signature or not. Large file nodes may take too long to compute their signature, in which case this attributes comes in handy.

The update' method should be called to initilize the signature and attributes attributes from the local filesystem, but this implies that the nodes exists on the file system. Otherwise the attributes' and `contentSignature' attributes can be set by hand.

Class NodeState

The abstract class for representing the state of filesystem files and directories.

Method __init__

__init__( self, rootLocation, rootNodeState=None, populate=False, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a new state with the given location as the root. If the populate variable is set to True, then the state is populated with the data gathered from the fielsystem.

Note that the given rootNodeState is NOT UPDATED automatically, because it may not exist on the local filesystem.

By default, no root node is created, you can create one with the populate method.

Method __repr__

__repr__( self )
Undocumented

Method accepts

accepts( self, a )

Specifies the GLOBS (as strings) that all inserted node must match.

Method cacheNodeState

cacheNodeState( self, node )

Caches a node information in this state. This registers the node signature and location so that it can be processed by the change tracking.

Method cacheNodeStates

cacheNodeStates( self )
Undocumented

Method getAbsoluteLocation

getAbsoluteLocation( self, location )

Returns the absolute location of the given relative location

Method getCreationTime

getCreationTime( self )

Returns the time at which this state was created

Method location

location( self, path=None )

Returns the absolute location of this state in the local filesystem.

Method nodeWithLocation

nodeWithLocation( self, location )

Returns the node with the given location. The node may not exist, in which case None is returned.

Method nodesByContentSignature

nodesByContentSignature( self )
Undocumented

Method nodesByLocation

nodesByLocation( self )
Undocumented

Method nodesWithContentSignature

nodesWithContentSignature( self, signature )

Returns a list of nodes with the given content signature. The node may not exist, in which case None is returned.

Method populate

populate( self, nodeSignatureFilter= at 0x112c470> )

Creates the root node for this state. This node will be automatically updated and cached.

The nodeSignatureFilter is a predicate which tells if a node at the given location should compute its signature or not.

Method rejects

rejects( self, a )

Specifies the GLOBS (as strings) that tell which node should never be added.

Method root

root( self, node=None )

Returns this state root node.

Class State

A state object reflects the state of a particular file system location by creating node objects (NodeStates) that represent the file system state at a particular moment.. These nodes can be later queried by location and signature.

Method detectChanges

detectChanges( self, newState, previousState, method='Time' )

Detects the changes between the new state and the previous state. This returns a Change object representing all changes.

Method onCreated

onCreated( self, node )

Handler called when a node was created, ie. it is present in the new state and not in the old one.

Method onModified

onModified( self, newNode, oldNode )

Handler called when a node was modified, ie. it is not the same in the new and in the old state.

Method onRemoved

onRemoved( self, node )

Handler called when a node was removed, ie. it is not the in the new state but is in the old state.

Method onUnmodified

onUnmodified( self, newNode, oldNode )
Undocumented

Class Tracker

Creates a change object that characterises the difference between the two states.

Function guessNodeStateAncestors

guessNodeStateAncestors( node, nodes )

Returns an order list of (percentage, nodes) indicating the probability for each node to be an ancestor of the current node.

You should look at the source code for more information on how the percentage is avaluated.

Function sets

sets( firstSet, secondSet, objectAccessor= at 0x112c370> )

Returns elements that are unique to first and second set, then elements that are common to both.

Returns the following sets:

  • elements only in first set
  • elements only in second set
  • elements common to both sets

The objectAccessor operation is used on each object of the set to access the element that will be used as a comparison basis. By default, it is the element itself.

str

" sink compare [OPTIONS] [OPERATION] ORIGIN COMPARED...\n\n ORIGIN is the directory to which we want to compare the others\n COMPARED is a list of directories that will be compared to ORIGIN\n\n Options:\n\n -c, --content (DEF) Uses content analysis to detect changes\n -t, --time Uses timestamp to detect changes\n --ignore-spaces Ignores the spaces when analyzing the content\n --ignore GLOBS Ignores the files that match the glob\n --only GLOBS Only accepts the file that match glob\n --filter PATTERN Tells which files you want to list\n\n You can also specify what you want to be listed in the diff:\n\n [-+]s Hides/Shows SAME files [=]\n [-+]a Hides/Shows ADDED files [+]\n [-+]r Hides/Shows REMOVED files !\n [-+]m Hides/Shows MODIFIED files [>] or [<]\n [-+]n Hides/Shows NEWER files [>]\n [-+]o Hides/Shows OLDER files [<]\n\n PATTERN is a string containing any of the symbols between braces ([?])\n listed above (eg. --filter '+-<>').\n\n GLOBS understand '*' and '?', will refer to the basename and can be\n separated by commas. If a directory matches the glob, it will not be\n traversed (ex: --ignore '*.pyc,*.bak,.[a-z]*')\n\n"

Method _mtime

_mtime( self, path )

Returns the modification time of the file at the give path.

Method _read

_read( self, path, getContent=True )

Resolves the given path and returns a couple (path, content) when getContent=True, or (path, callback) where callback will return the content of the file when invoked.

Method _readLocal

_readLocal( self, path )

Reads a file from the local file system.

Method _sha

Undocumented

Method _size

_size( self, path )

Returns the size of the file at the give path.

Method add

add( self, collection, source, destination )

Adds a link from the source to the destination

Method init

init( self, path='.' )

Initializes a link collection (link db) at the given location.

Method linkStatus

linkStatus( self, collection, link )

Returns a couple (CONTENT_STATUS, FILE_STATUS) where CONTENT_STATUS is any of ST_SAME, ST_DIFFERENT, ST_EMPTY, ST_NOT_THERE and FILE_STATUS is any of ST_SAME, ST_NEWER, ST_OLDER.

Method remove

remove( self, collection, links, delete=False )

Remove the given list of links from the collection.

Method resolveLink

resolveLink( self, collection, link )

Returns ta couple (path, content) corresponding to the resolution of the given link.

The return value is the same as the _read method.

Method run

run( self, arguments )

Runs the command using the given list of arguments (a list of strings).

setup( self, config )

Sets up the engine using the given configuration object.

update( self, collection, *links )

Updates the given links, or all if no link is specified.

Method updateLink

updateLink( self, collection, link, force=False )

Updates the given link to the content of the link source

Class Engine

Implements operations that can be done on a link collection. Operations include giving status, resolving a link, and updating a link.

Method __init__

__init__( self, root, dbfile='.sink-links' )

Creates a new link collection object, using the given root.

Method __str__

__str__( self )

Serializes the collection to a string

Method _normalizeDestination

_normalizeDestination( self, destination )

Normalizes the destination path, making it relative to the collection root, and discarding the leading /

Method dbpath

dbpath( self )

Returns the absolute patht ot the DB file.

Method exists

exists( self )

Tells if the collection exists on the filesystem.

Method getLinks

getLinks( self )

Returns a list of (source, dest) where source and dest are absolute expanded paths representing the link source and destination.

Method getSource

getSource( self, destination )

Returns the source for the given destination, in its unexpanded form.

Method load

load( self )

Loads the given collection.

Method registerLink

registerLink( self, source, destination )

Registers a link from the given source path to the given destination. Source is stored as-is (meaning that variables won't be expanded), and destination will be expanded and be expressed relatively to the collection root.

This implies that destination must be contained in the collection root directory.

Method removeLink

removeLink( self, link, delete=False )

Removes the link from this link collection. The file is only delete if the delete option is True.

Method save

save( self )

Saves the link collection to the dbpath() file.

Function lookup

lookup( path='.' )

Looks for a file .versions-links or .hg/version-links in the current path or in a parent path.

str

"Link source for '%s' not found: %s"

str(object) -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

str

" sink link allows to create synchronisation links between files. It is\n especially useful when files are shared between different projects.\n\n Available operations are:\n\n link init Initializes a link database for a specific folder\n link add Creates a link between two file\n link remove Removes a link between two files\n link status Gives the status of linked files\n link update Updates the linked files\n\n sink link init [PATH]\n\n Initialises the link database for the current folder, or the folder at the\n given PATH. If PATH is omitted, it will use the current folder, or will look\n for a Mercurial (.hg) repository in the parent directories, and will use it\n to store the links database.\n\n There are no options for this command.\n\n sink link add [OPTIONS] SOURCE DESTINATION\n\n Creates a link from the the SOURCE to the DESTINATION. The DESTINATION must\n be contained in a directory where the 'link init' command was run.\n\n Options:\n\n -w, --writable Link will be made writable (so that you can update it)\n\n sink link status [PATH|LINK]...\n\n Returns the status of the given links. If no link is given, the status of\n all links will be returned. When no argument is given, the current\n directory (or one of its parent) must contain a link database, otherwise\n you should give a PATH containing a link databae.\n\n sink link update [OPTIONS] [PATH|LINK]...\n\n Updates the given links in the current or given PATH, or updates only the\n given list of LINKs (they must belong to the same link DB, accessible from\n the current path).\n\n If the link is newer than the source and has modifications, then the update\n will not happen unless it is --force'd.\n\n You can also merge back the changes by using '--merge'. This will start\n your favorite $MERGETOOL.\n\n Options:\n\n -f, --force Forces the update, ignoring local modifications\n -m, --merge Uses the $MERGETOOL to merge the link source and dest\n\n sink link remove LINK [LINK..]\n\n Removes one or more link from the link database. The links destinations\n won't be removed from the filesystem unlesse you specify '--delete'.\n\n Options:\n\n -d, --delete Deletes the link destination (your local file)\n\n"

str(object) -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

Method getSignature

getSignature( self )

Returns the concatenation of the content signature and the attributes signature, separated by a dash.

Method getData

getData( self )

Returns the data contained in this file as a string.

Method __init__

__init__( self, rootLocation, rootNodeState=None, populate=False, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a new state with the given location as the root. If the populate variable is set to True, then the state is populated with the data gathered from the fielsystem.

Note that the given rootNodeState is NOT UPDATED automatically, because it may not exist on the local filesystem.

By default, no root node is created, you can create one with the populate method.

wrapper_descriptor

1.repr_() <==> repr(x)

Method update

update( self, nodeSignatureFilter= at 0x112c070> )

Updates the given directory node signature and attributes-information. The directory node location MUST exist.

The nodeSignatureFilter allows to filter each node and decided wether its signature should be computed or not. By default, every node has its signature computed.

WARNING: Updating a directory nodes updates its children list according to the local file system, so new nodes are always created for new directories and files.

Method walkChildren

walkChildren( self, function, context=None )

Applies the given function to every child of this node.

Method _appendToWalkPath

_appendToWalkPath( self, walkPath )

Appends this node to the given walk path. This allows to iterate nodes using the given `walkPath', which is a list.

Directory node is appended first, then children are appended in alphabetical order.

Method getChildren

getChildren( self, types=None )

Returns the children of this directory. The optional `types' list enumerates the classes of the the returned children, acting as a type filter. By default, types are DirectoryNodeState and FileNodeState.

str

"Sink - v.0.9.8\n\n Sink is the swiss army-knife for many common development synchronisation\n needs.\n\n Usage: sink [OPERATION?] [ARGUMENTS]\n\n OPERATION the operation you want to use ('changes' by default, see below)\n ARGUMENTS the arguments to the operations (use --help to know more)\n\n Operations:\n\n changes (DEF) Lists the changes between two or more directories\n link Manage synchrnoisation links between files\n help Gives detailed help about a specific operation\n\n Type 'sink help changes' or 'sink changes --help' to get detailed information\n about the 'changes' operation.\n\n"

str

" sink link allows to create synchronisation links between files. It is\n especially useful when files are shared between different projects.\n\n Available operations are:\n\n link init Initializes a link database for a specific folder\n link add Creates a link between two file\n link remove Removes a link between two files\n link status Gives the status of linked files\n link update Updates the linked files\n\n sink link init [PATH]\n\n Initialises the link database for the current folder, or the folder at the\n given PATH. If PATH is omitted, it will use the current folder, or will look\n for a Mercurial (.hg) repository in the parent directories, and will use it\n to store the links database.\n\n There are no options for this command.\n\n sink link add [OPTIONS] SOURCE DESTINATION\n\n Creates a link from the the SOURCE to the DESTINATION. The DESTINATION must\n be contained in a directory where the 'link init' command was run.\n\n Options:\n\n -w, --writable Link will be made writable (so that you can update it)\n\n sink link status [PATH|LINK]...\n\n Returns the status of the given links. If no link is given, the status of\n all links will be returned. When no argument is given, the current\n directory (or one of its parent) must contain a link database, otherwise\n you should give a PATH containing a link databae.\n\n sink link update [OPTIONS] [PATH|LINK]...\n\n Updates the given links in the current or given PATH, or updates only the\n given list of LINKs (they must belong to the same link DB, accessible from\n the current path).\n\n If the link is newer than the source and has modifications, then the update\n will not happen unless it is --force'd.\n\n You can also merge back the changes by using '--merge'. This will start\n your favorite $MERGETOOL.\n\n Options:\n\n -f, --force Forces the update, ignoring local modifications\n -m, --merge Uses the $MERGETOOL to merge the link source and dest\n\n sink link remove LINK [LINK..]\n\n Removes one or more link from the link database. The links destinations\n won't be removed from the filesystem unlesse you specify '--delete'.\n\n Options:\n\n -d, --delete Deletes the link destination (your local file)\n\n"

Method __init__

__init__( self, state, location, usesSignature=True, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a file system node with the given location. The location is relative to the state root. The usesSignature parameter allows to specify wether the node should use a signature or not. Large file nodes may take too long to compute their signature, in which case this attributes comes in handy.

The update' method should be called to initilize the signature and attributes attributes from the local filesystem, but this implies that the nodes exists on the file system. Otherwise the attributes' and `contentSignature' attributes can be set by hand.

Class State

A state object reflects the state of a particular file system location by creating node objects (NodeStates) that represent the file system state at a particular moment.. These nodes can be later queried by location and signature.

Function sets

sets( firstSet, secondSet, objectAccessor= at 0x112c370> )

Returns elements that are unique to first and second set, then elements that are common to both.

Returns the following sets:

  • elements only in first set
  • elements only in second set
  • elements common to both sets

The objectAccessor operation is used on each object of the set to access the element that will be used as a comparison basis. By default, it is the element itself.

Method linkStatus

linkStatus( self, collection, link )

Returns a couple (CONTENT_STATUS, FILE_STATUS) where CONTENT_STATUS is any of ST_SAME, ST_DIFFERENT, ST_EMPTY, ST_NOT_THERE and FILE_STATUS is any of ST_SAME, ST_NEWER, ST_OLDER.

Method getAbsoluteLocation

getAbsoluteLocation( self )

Returns the node location, which implies that the location has been assigned a state.

Method name

name( self )

Returns the name of this node. This corresponds to the basename of this node location.

'.hg/sink-links'

str(object) -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

str

" sink compare [OPTIONS] [OPERATION] ORIGIN COMPARED...\n\n ORIGIN is the directory to which we want to compare the others\n COMPARED is a list of directories that will be compared to ORIGIN\n\n Options:\n\n -c, --content (DEF) Uses content analysis to detect changes\n -t, --time Uses timestamp to detect changes\n --ignore-spaces Ignores the spaces when analyzing the content\n --ignore GLOBS Ignores the files that match the glob\n --only GLOBS Only accepts the file that match glob\n --filter PATTERN Tells which files you want to list\n\n You can also specify what you want to be listed in the diff:\n\n [-+]s Hides/Shows SAME files [=]\n [-+]a Hides/Shows ADDED files [+]\n [-+]r Hides/Shows REMOVED files !\n [-+]m Hides/Shows MODIFIED files [>] or [<]\n [-+]n Hides/Shows NEWER files [>]\n [-+]o Hides/Shows OLDER files [<]\n\n PATTERN is a string containing any of the symbols between braces ([?])\n listed above (eg. --filter '+-<>').\n\n GLOBS understand '*' and '?', will refer to the basename and can be\n separated by commas. If a directory matches the glob, it will not be\n traversed (ex: --ignore '*.pyc,*.bak,.[a-z]*')\n\n"

Method __init__

__init__( self, state, location, usesSignature=True, accepts=(), rejects=() )

Creates a file system node with the given location. The location is relative to the state root. The usesSignature parameter allows to specify wether the node should use a signature or not. Large file nodes may take too long to compute their signature, in which case this attributes comes in handy.

The update' method should be called to initilize the signature and attributes attributes from the local filesystem, but this implies that the nodes exists on the file system. Otherwise the attributes' and `contentSignature' attributes can be set by hand.

str

'[+]'

str(object) -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

1.str_() <==> str(x)

Method registerLink

registerLink( self, source, destination )

Registers a link from the given source path to the given destination. Source is stored as-is (meaning that variables won't be expanded), and destination will be expanded and be expressed relatively to the collection root.

This implies that destination must be contained in the collection root directory.

load( self )

Function guessNodeStateAncestors

guessNodeStateAncestors( node, nodes )

Returns an order list of (percentage, nodes) indicating the probability for each node to be an ancestor of the current node.

You should look at the source code for more information on how the percentage is avaluated.

Method update

update( self, signatureFilter= at 0x111cc30> )

Creates the node by making the proper initilisation. The node MUST be available on the local filesystem when this method is run.

Class Tracker

Creates a change object that characterises the difference between the two states.

Method getAttributesSignature

getAttributesSignature( self )

Returns the signature of the attributes. Attributes listed in ATTRIBUTESNOTIN_SIGNATURE are not taken into account in the computation of the node signature.

Class Engine

Implements operations that can be done on a link collection. Operations include giving status, resolving a link, and updating a link.
